node.title: Twin girls die in tragic house fire in Byron Bay, NSW
node.description: The incident occurred just after 4am (local time) on Sunday morning.
node.content: ["Twin girls have died in a tragic house fire on Sunday morning (local time) in Byron Bay with police suspecting a candle caused the blaze.", "Emergency services were alerted to the fire on the New South Wales' Far North Coast shortly after 4am, after reports two children were suffering from smoke inhalation.\u00a0", "Police and ambulance paramedics tried to resuscitate the two four-year-old girls but were unable to do so and the twins died at the scene. A woman is also being treated for shock.", "The building which went up in flames is a shared home, with other families residing at the property about 30 kilometres west of Byron Bay.\u00a0\n", "Detectives are working with fire investigators to determine the cause of the blaze, but initial reports indicate a candle may have been left burning inside the home.", "A police spokeswoman said the fire was \"smouldering\" with low-level flames when fire and rescue, police and paramedics arrived at the scene.\u00a0", "The spokeswoman said damage to the building was mostly due to smoke and not fire, with no major structural damage.", "\u00a0"]
